bibl.title: Letter from J.F. Siler to Philip Showalter Hench, September 28, 1951

div1.p: Siler informs Hench that nothing special is coming up at the annual meeting of the Walter Reed Memorial Association. Since Hench will be unavailable this time, he hopes to see him at next year's meeting.

div1.head: Letter from J.F. Siler to Philip Showalter Hench, September 28, 1951
div1.opener:
GORGAS MEMORIAL INSTITUTE
OF
TROPICAL AND PREVENTIVE MEDICINE
INCORPORATED
-----
GORGAS MEMORIAL LABORATORY
EXECUTIVE OFFICES
1835 EYE STREET, NORTHWEST
WASHINGTON 6, D. C.
September 28, 1951
JOSEPH F. SILER
PRESIDENT
MAURICE H. THATCHER
VICE PRESIDENT AND GENERAL COUNSEL
WALTER A. BLOEDORN
SECRETARY
Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
My dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
This will confirm my telephone conversation with you of a few minutes
ago.

I failed to explain that the address on your letter was correct for
my former residence, 3434 - 34th Place, but that on the outside of the en
velope it appeared as 3434 - 34th Street. We lived at the 34th Place
address for several years but about three years ago we moved closer in and
are now at 2220 - 20th Street, N. W., Washington 9.

It was a very great pleasure to talk to you by phone and we would like
very much to see you later in the fall but, as I explained to you, there is
nothing special coming up at the annual meeting of the Walter Reed Memorial
Association and I see no reason why you should curtail your visit to your
family to make a trip to Washington for a meeting. Furthermore, General
Love is out of the city at the present time and I do not know when he expects
to return. I think therefore that it will be best to go ahead as usual and
plan our meeting for a date near the anniversary of Reed's death.

I hope that next year you may happen to be in this part of the country
in the middle or latter part of November and that we may have the pleasure
of seeing you at a meeting at that time.

With very best regards and best wishes for a delightful trip to Cuba
in January,
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, J. F. Siler
Col., (MC), U.S.A., Rtd. jfs k
